The claim is based on an illustration th: 2020, and has been shared hundreds of times.
The Facebook post and caption suggest th: 19 compromises the blood-brain barrier, raising concerns about the potential dangers of the test.
Expert opinions from Professor John Dwye: an immunologist, and Emeritus Professor at the University of New South Wales, and Professor John Mathews, an epidemiologist at the University of Melbourne, both state that the swab test does not compromise the blood-brain barrier and does not pose any threat to the nervous system.
The Queensland Brain Institute explains: brain barrier serves as a defense against disease-causing pathogens and toxins in the blood, further supporting the assertion that the swab test does not compromise it.
